subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit on an RMI Server
msgSnippet: ... Hash: SHA1 I would suggest you mock the RMI server interface.  You shouldn t need to test the operation of the server itself. I usually use Easymock to
messageBody:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

I would suggest you mock the RMI server interface. You shouldn't
need to test the operation of the server itself.

I usually use Easymock to generate mocks, but there are several
packages available.


- --
Jim McMaster
mailto:jim.mcmaster@...






________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of David Whyte
Sent: Monday, May 09, 2005 7:22 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Using JUnit on an RMI Server


I have been provided an RMI Server and I wish to write some JUnits
to
ensure that I have coded against the interface correctly.

I am wandering how I would go about testing this interface with
JUnit,
so that the server is registered and started before the tests begin
etc.

Are there any tools available to help with this?

Cheers,
Whytey
